title: ‘Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4’: What Dr V Narayanan Said After Becoming New ISRO Chief - News18
summary:
Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: Insights from New ISRO Chief Dr V Narayanan

Date: January 08, 2025 | Source: News18

Rocket Scientist Dr V Narayanan has been appointed as the new chief of ISRO, expressing his commitment to improve the lives of Indians through technology and scientific advancements.

  • Dr V Narayanan considers his new role a great responsibility.
  • He has a clear plan for upcoming missions including Chandrayaan-4 and Gaganyan.
  • Dr Narayanan aims for advancements in climate studies, disaster management, communication, and earth observation.
  • His family expresses immense pride in his new position and contributions.
“Basically, the country needs a lot of things in terms of climate studies, disaster management system, communication requirements, satellites for communication, and earth observation.” – Dr V Narayanan

This appointment marks a hopeful new chapter for India's space aspirations as Dr Narayanan strives to enhance technology for societal benefit.
newTitle: Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: Insights from New ISRO Chief Dr V Narayanan

Bhima Koregaon: Bombay High Court grants bail to Rona Wilson, Sudhir Dhawale - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Bombay High Court Grants Bail to Rona Wilson and Sudhir Dhawale in Bhima Koregaon Case

Published on: 08 Jan 2025, 11:30 am

The Bombay High Court has granted bail to Rona Wilson and Sudhir Dhawale, two individuals accused in the 2018 Bhima Koregaon violence case, citing prolonged confinement and the need to examine numerous witnesses.

  • Bail granted on the condition of ₹1 lakh bail bonds.
  • Accused are required to report to the National Investigation Agency every Monday.
  • Court previously denied default bail to the accused in July 2024.
  • Wilson has been in custody since July 2018 under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act.
  • The Bhima Koregaon case originated from an event in 2017 that commemorated a significant clash involving Dalit soldiers.
“Prolonged incarceration, non-framing of charges, and the necessity to examine over 300 witnesses were key reasons for granting bail.”

In conclusion, the bail decision reflects ongoing judicial scrutiny of the lengthy detention of the accused in the wake of complex and significant legal narratives surrounding the Bhima Koregaon case.
newTitle: Bombay High Court Grants Bail to Rona Wilson and Sudhir Dhawale in Bhima Koregaon Case

title: Delhi election: Arvind Kejriwal accuses BJP of asking 7 MPs to make 'fake votes' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Attempting Electoral Fraud Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A day after the Election Commission ruled out the possibility of electoral roll manipulation, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal accused the Bharatiya Janata Party of attempting to create fake votes ahead of the upcoming Delhi assembly elections.

  • Kejriwal claims BJP assigned targets to 7 MPs for creating fake votes.
  • Chief Minister Atishi plans to meet the Chief Election Commissioner regarding the allegations.
  • Election Commission dismisses charges of voter deletion and manipulation.
  • The Delhi assembly elections are scheduled for February 5, with counting on February 8.
“According to sources, the Gaali Galauj Party has given targets to its seven MPs to get fake votes made...” - Arvind Kejriwal

The upcoming elections have sparked significant controversy, with allegations of manipulation threatening the integrity of the voting process.
newTitle: Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Attempting Electoral Fraud Ahead of Delhi Elections

Domestic Violence Act Cases Have No Penal Consequence Except For Breach Of Protection Order: Supreme Court Criticises Issuance Of Bailable Warrants - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Criticizes Bailable Warrants in Domestic Violence Cases

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has criticized the issuance of bailable warrants by a Magistrate in cases under the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005. The court noted that such warrants are unjustified as these cases are quasi-criminal proceedings.

  • The Court stated that bailable warrants should not be issued in domestic violence cases.
  • It emphasized that these proceedings do not carry penal consequences unless a protection order is violated.
  • The petitioner, who has a specially abled minor son and is unemployed, was subjected to unwarranted bailable warrants.
  • The case was transferred from Delhi to Ludhiana by the Supreme Court.
“This Court is constrained to observe that there is no justification whatsoever for the Trial Court to have issued bailable warrants...” - Justice Sandeep Mehta

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's remarks aim to clarify the appropriate handling of bailable warrants in cases concerning the Domestic Violence Act.
newTitle: Supreme Court Criticizes Bailable Warrants in Domestic Violence Cases

title: Delhi News Live Updates: AAP leaders stopped from entering Delhi CM’s residence, now march towards PM’s house - The Indian Express
summary:
AAP MPs Protest as Delhi Elections Approach

Publication Date: January 8, 2025

Source: Indian Express

The political landscape in Delhi is heating up ahead of the 2025 assembly elections, with AAP and BJP trading barbs.

  • The Election Commission has announced voting for February 5, 2025, and results will be declared on February 8.
  • AAP challenges BJP to reveal the truth about renovations in the Chief Minister's residence.
  • Delhi is experiencing a cold wave, with temperatures expected to fall to 5 degrees Celsius.
  • Foggy conditions are causing disruptions in transportation.
Sanjay Singh challenged the BJP to open the gates of Arvind Kejriwal’s ‘Sheesh Mahal’ to prove transparency.

This unfolding political drama is significant as the AAP seeks to maintain its governance amid increased scrutiny from the BJP.
newTitle: AAP MPs Protest as Delhi Elections Approach

Does woman with below average intelligence have no right to be a mother? Bombay High Court asks - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Bombay High Court Addresses Rights of Pregnant Woman with Below Average Intelligence

Published on: 08 Jan 2025, 7:44 am

The Bombay High Court ruled on a case involving a 27-year-old pregnant woman, whose adoptive father sought to terminate her pregnancy due to her below-average intelligence. The court reaffirmed her right to motherhood amid questions about her mental capacity.

  • The woman, over 20 weeks pregnant, refused consent for abortion.
  • A medical board found both the woman and the foetus to be physically normal.
  • The court highlighted that having below-average intelligence does not negate her right to be a mother.
  • The father adopted the woman when she was six months old and expressed concerns about her mental health and ability to care for a child.
  • The court emphasized parental responsibility and urged the father to support his daughter's choices.
"Observation is she has below average intelligence. Nobody can be super intelligent.. we are human beings, everybody has different level of intelligence. Because she has below average intelligence, she has no right to be a mother?"

The case is set to continue on January 13, during which the court will determine if the woman's partner is willing to marry her.
newTitle: Bombay High Court Addresses Rights of Pregnant Woman with Below Average Intelligence

title: SARFAESI | Borrower's Right Of Redemption Available Only Till Notice For Sale Of Mortgaged Asset Is... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Rules on Borrower's Right of Redemption Under SARFAESI Act

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has clarified that the right of a borrower to redeem a secured asset under the SARFAESI Act can only be exercised until a notice for the sale of the property is published.

  • The court emphasized the importance of the 2016 amendment to the SARFAESI Act.
  • Before the amendment, borrowers could redeem their properties until the sale was completed.
  • Now, the redemption right is limited to the period before the sale notice is published.
  • The case involved the cancellation of an auction sale by the Delhi High Court, which was overturned by the Supreme Court.
“...the right of redemption is not unfettered and there is a statutory limitation prescribed to it...”

Case Title: Sanjay Sharma v. Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd.
newTitle: Supreme Court Rules on Borrower's Right of Redemption Under SARFAESI Act

title: Karnataka High Court Strikes Down Centre's Green Energy Open Access Rules, Says It Lacks Legislative... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Karnataka High Court Overturns Central Government's Green Energy Access Rules

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date Here]Source: [Insert Source Here]

The Karnataka High Court has invalidated the Electricity (Promoting Renewable Energy Through Green Energy Open Access) Rules 2022, determining that the Central Government lacked the legislative authority to frame these rules.

  • The Court emphasized that only the Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission (KERC) has the power to establish regulations in this context.
  • Justice N S Sanjay Gowda stated that the government's involvement in tariff determination was detrimental to the electricity industry's growth.
  • The incorrect framing of these rules by the Centre was deemed a significant overreach of its authority.
  • The KERC has been directed to create new regulations regarding open access to green energy.
“If the Parliament made a law specifically conferring power on the Regulator to frame Regulations which governed every aspect of open access, it is inconceivable that the Central Government can side-step the requirement of the Parliament enacting a law in that regard and straight away proceed to frame the impugned Rules.”

The Court has ensured continuity by allowing existing agreements for wheeling and banking to remain in effect until new regulations are adopted by KERC.
newTitle: Karnataka High Court Overturns Central Government's Green Energy Access Rules

title: NDPS Act | Seized Vehicle Not Liable To Be Confiscated If Accused Used It Without Owner's Knowledge Or... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Ruling on Vehicle Seizure Under NDPS Act

Publication Date: January 7, 2025

Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court ruled that a vehicle seized under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act cannot be confiscated if the owner proves it was used without their knowledge.

  • The Court stated that vehicle owners can avoid confiscation if they show they took reasonable precautions against unauthorized use.
  • Confiscation can only occur after the trial concludes, with an opportunity for the owner to be heard.
  • This ruling reverses a prior decision by the Gauhati High Court regarding interim release of seized vehicles.
“The seized vehicle is not liable to confiscation if the owner can prove that the vehicle was used by the accused without the owner's knowledge...”

For further details, see the full judgment here.
newTitle: Supreme Court Ruling on Vehicle Seizure Under NDPS Act

title: Who is Anita Anand? Top contender to replace Justin Trudeau as Canadian PM - The Hindu
summary:
Who is Anita Anand? Top contender to replace Justin Trudeau as Canadian PM

Published on: January 08, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

As speculation grows about Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s future as leader of the Liberal Party, Anita Anand has emerged as a frontrunner to replace him. Anand is recognized for her decisive leadership and has held several high-profile positions in the government.

  • Anand is Canada’s first woman Defence Minister and has been a senior member of the Liberal Party since 2019.
  • She is credited with leading military modernization efforts and ensuring robust support for Ukraine.
  • As Minister of Transport since 2024, she focuses on modernizing Canada’s infrastructure and addressing climate change.
  • Anand would be the first woman of color and first Canadian of Indian origin to become Prime Minister if selected.
  • Trudeau has announced he will resign, leading to a competitive leadership race within the Liberal Party.
If selected to replace Trudeau, Anita Anand would make history as the first woman of color and the first Canadian of Indian origin to become Canada’s Prime Minister.

In conclusion, Anita Anand's potential leadership represents a significant milestone in Canadian politics, with implications for representation and diversity in governance.
newTitle: Who is Anita Anand? Top contender to replace Justin Trudeau as Canadian PM

title: States have money to give freebies but not to retired judges: SC - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court Criticizes States for Prioritizing Freebies Over Judicial Compensation

Published on: January 08, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court criticized states for providing financial incentives to the public while claiming financial difficulties in compensating retired judges. This statement was made during a hearing regarding a plea for pension equality for judges from the All India Judges Association.

  • The Supreme Court pointed out that funds are available for public freebies but insufficient for judicial salaries and pensions.
  • Attorney General R. Venkataramani noted that financial constraints should be acknowledged regarding judges' pay.
  • The court mentioned various election-related financial schemes being proposed by political parties.
  • The case has been under consideration since 2015, highlighting grievances concerning pensions for retired judges.
  • Judges criticized the low pension amounts received by some retired High Court judges, indicating stark disparities in remuneration.
"The States have all the money for the people who don't do any work... Come elections, you declare ladli behna and other new schemes..."

This observation raises concerns about the prioritization of public finances and the treatment of the judiciary, reflecting on the welfare of those who have served in judicial capacities.
newTitle: Supreme Court Criticizes States for Prioritizing Freebies Over Judicial Compensation

title: Majority says simultaneous elections won't cause confusion among voters: News18 Pulse - Moneycontrol
‘Obscene remarks’ against actor Honey Rose: Businessman Boby Chemmanur taken into Kerala Police custody - The Indian Express
summary:
Businessman Boby Chemmanur in Custody for Obscene Remarks Against Actor Honey Rose

Date: Wednesday
Source: Indian Express

Kerala Police took businessman Boby Chemmanur into custody on Wednesday for making obscene remarks about Malayalam actor Honey Rose. The case stemmed from comments made during a jewelry showroom inauguration and social media harassment.

Honey Rose filed a complaint against Chemmanur along with around 30 others, claiming she was subjected to sexist comments online. She stated, "You (Chemmanur) believe in money power, I believe in the country’s legal system." Chemmanur denied any wrongdoing, claiming his remarks were misunderstood.

  • Chemmanur was arrested after police registered a case against him.
  • Honey Rose reported psychological distress due to ongoing harassment.
  • Prominent figures in the film industry have shown support for Honey Rose.
Honey Rose expressed relief at the arrest, stating, "I was being stalked and targeted repeatedly... I should have reacted much earlier."

The incident has been widely discussed in Kerala, raising awareness about harassment and reinforcing support for the actor.
newTitle: Businessman Boby Chemmanur in Custody for Obscene Remarks Against Actor Honey Rose

title: News18 Pulse: One Nation, One Election | 80.1% Respondents Back Reform; Support Highest In Central India - News18
summary:
News18 Pulse: One Nation, One Election | 80.1% Respondents Back Reform; Support Highest In Central India

Last Updated: January 08, 2025, 17:31 IST

The proposal for simultaneous elections, known as the One Nation, One Poll (ONOP) plan, has garnered significant support across India, with 80.1% of respondents favoring the move, according to a nationwide News18 survey conducted between December 23-31, 2024.

  • 90.7% support in Central India.
  • 87.3% in North India.
  • 84% in East India.
  • Support lower in North East (73.9%), West (72.9%), and South (69.7%).
  • 81.2% believe simultaneous polls will save public money and reduce expenditure.
  • 50% confident voters can differentiate between national and state candidates.
“The Constitution (129th Amendment) Bill and the Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill were introduced in the Lok Sabha during the Winter Session.”

In conclusion, public opinion favoring the ONOP proposal indicates a growing sentiment towards reducing electoral disruptions, highlighting the need for legislative and logistical readiness in facilitating this change.
newTitle: Support for One Nation, One Election Surges in India
